Job Description

JOIN THE TEAM THAT’S POWERING PROGRESS

Building cities. Driving commerce. Saving lives. For over 100 years, Allison Transmission has powered the vehicles and technology that move our world forward.

What powers us? Our employees. From the first person hired by James Allison in 1915 to the thousands across the globe who work for Allison today, we’re driving progress everywhere because we employ top talent worldwide.

This is an exciting opportunity in Indianapolis for a Service Engineer Internship. Learn more about this role and how you can begin driving your career forward!

Service Engineering provides assistance to the Allison service network, fleets, and other organizations, ultimately supporting customer vehicle uptime and the Allison Promise. Key learning and development areas include failure analysis, technical document construction, basic product design, transmission integration, and exposure to embedded control systems. Students will work closely with their assigned supervisor and complete a specific project during the assignment. Students will be required to commit to a minimum of 10-weeks per assignment.

Primary Duties And Responsibilities

Exposure to Allison’s products and organization through support of cross-functional teams and initiativesSupport investigation and analysis of failed transmissions and/or parts, with a focus on vehicle up-time and the Allison customer experienceParticipate in development of investigative plans for emerging or major issuesSupport preparation of technical documents to inform service network of product issues, product updates, and releasesSupport the development of specialized training and tools, as-neededSupport the Allison Technical Assistance Center

Education And Qualifications

College undergraduate or graduate status with 2-3 years at an accredited college or university, pursing a degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, Computer Engineering, Automotive, or related fieldPreferred 3.0 GPA in major
Skills And Competencies

Basic technical skillsStrong desire to learn and initiative to participate in a collaborative environmentBasic mechanical aptitudeStrong analytical skillsProficient with MS Office

Additional Intern Program Activities (some Optional)

Dedicated mentor throughout the internship assignmentStudents vs. Mentors softball and kickball tournamentCommunity service dayLeadership meet & greet eventAllison Transmission Vehicle Ride & Drive on the test trackOpportunities to work cross-functionally in a Global Headquarters
